name: Jan van Eijck
content: Jan van Eijck Jan van Eijck Home Activities Publications Manuscripts Courses Software Philosophy Contact About Me photograph by Yanjing Wang I am a Senior Researcher at CWI (Centre for Mathematics and Computer Science), Amsterdam, and part time full professor of computational semantics at ILLC (Institute for Logic, Language and Computation), Amsterdam. Until november 2011 I was part-time full professor of computational linguistics at Uil-OTS (Research Institute for Language and Speech), Utrecht. I teach Software Specification and Testing in the Master of Software Engineering curriculum at the University of Amsterdam. I am former scientific director of the Dutch Research School in Logic (1997 -- 2002). I am a former employee of SRI-International (Cambridge UK Laboratory), where I was involved in the design of an industrial scale natural language processing project. Before that, I held an associate professorship at the University of Tilburg. I have a PhD from the University of Groningen (1985). Here is my CV. The Haskell Road to Logic, Mahs and Programming, Second Edition, by Kees Doets and Jan van Eijck, appeared in January 2013. The book copyright page says 2012, but I received the copies in January 2013. The second edition has a new section on computing polynomial representations for number sequences, using the calculus of finite differences, plus updated code, and error corrections. Together with Floor Sietsma, I published a follow-op paper on Action Emulation, in The Journal of Philosophical Logic. This appeared in December 2013.
